author: Nicola Barnes
title: Concept Searching Client Experience Webinar Series Now Available
text:
Concept Searching , the global leader in semantic metadata generation, auto-classification, and taxonomy management software, and developer of the Smart Content Framework™, is pleased to announce the availability of webinars focused on the customer, and includes guest speakers from diverse organizations and industries, who have deployed Concept Searching technologies to automatically generate business critical metadata to solve a variety of business challenges. Poor or non-existent metadata is a fundamental issue, impacting many business processes and applications. Few organizations proactively manage metadata to improve business outcomes.
“Our client webinars are a testament to our products. They represent a snapshot of real-life issues that audiences may also be facing, and examine how the challenges were met. The webinars are led by Concept Searching clients, providing a first-hand explanations of how they were able to leverage metadata to achieve their business goals,” said Martin Garland, President of Concept Searching. “These clients all faced very different challenges, all due to poor metadata. That is the biggest strength of our products, as they are part of an infrastructure component that can be used to solve a multitude of metadata challenges,” he concluded.
Collaboration, Search, and Information Governance
A premier US program management firm’s goal was to update its SharePoint 2010 intranet, to refresh an out-of-the-box design and to mine an immense amount of data, to enhance findability of its content and provide staff with easily accessible data. The existing intranet lacked a clear governance structure, effective information architecture, and mobile accessibility.
This webinar discusses how conceptClassifier for SharePoint was used to quickly identify duplicate documents within the current SharePoint environment and file shares. The technology solution easily migrated content, automatically applied content types, and aligned governance policies, enabling the intranet portal to be significantly improved.
Eliminating End User Tagging
The leading iUS nformation provider for the mortgage industry wanted to improve findability and search for its mortgage lending content library. This webinar explores the benefits of metadata management, standardization, and auto-classification of content to taxonomies.
This was a business-critical project, with hundreds of thousands of documents that had to be tagged and classified for clients to access on demand. The conceptClassifier platform was used as the key tool for the team of publishers, to keep up with demand and ultimately increase accuracy in search for site visitors.
External Self-serve Portal
This US nonprofit organization, with a mission to contribute to the prevention and cure of cancer, provides details on how its online patient portal was developed and deployed using conceptClassifier.
The challenge met was how to provide individual patients with information most relevant to their specific health situations, while ensuring the information was accurate, medically sound, and secure. The solution delivered the ability to search across multiple pools of information inside and outside the company, and was easy to use for patients of all ages and demographics.
eDiscovery
The UK’s 9th largest council shares why it purchased the Concept Searching Technology platform and what it is being used for today. Originally acquired to track information assets for the delivery of over 300 discrete services, the Concept Searching solution is now being used to support eDiscovery efforts for legal compliance.
The flexibility of the technologies enhances search outcomes by significantly improving the retrieval of highly precise and relevant information. This is particularly useful when information is scattered throughout the enterprise in diverse repositories. The solution delivers compliance with regulatory requirements and adherence to applicable laws, which are of paramount importance to a public sector organization.
All the client webinars can be accessed on the Concept Searching website here .
About Concept Searching
Concept Searching is the industry leader specializing in semantic metadata generation, auto-classification, and taxonomy management. Platform agnostic, Concept Searching also has a Microsoft Gold Application Development competency, and offers a complete suite of SharePoint and Office 365 solutions. The award winning technologies integrated with Concept Searching’s Smart Content Framework™ encompass the entire portfolio of unstructured information assets in on-premises, cloud, or hybrid environments. Clients have deployed the intelligent metadata enabled solutions to improve search, records management, identification and protection of privacy data, migration, text analytics, eDiscovery, and enterprise social networking applications.
Concept Searching is headquartered in the US with offices in the UK, Canada and South Africa.
